Regulation Name(s): Gastrointestinal pathogen panel multiplex nucleic acid-based assay system
Analyte(s): Campylobacter (C. jejuni, C. coli, C. lari)
Shiga-like Toxin producing E. coli (STEC) stx1/stx2
Shigella (S. boydii, S. sonnei, S. flexneri, S. dysenteriae)
Giardia (G. lamblia, G. intestinalis, G. duodenalis)
Instrument(s)/Platform(s): Luminex 100/200 instrument system with xPONENT software
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for the xTAG Gastrointestinal Pathogen Panel (GPP), a multiplex RT-PCR bead array assay for simultaneous qualitative detection of viral, bacterial, and parasitic nucleic acids in stool specimens.
Indications for Use Summary: Multiplexed qualitative detection and identification of multiple viral, bacterial, and parasitic nucleic acids in human stool or stool in Cary-Blair media from individuals with signs and symptoms of infectious colitis or gastroenteritis, aiding in diagnosis of GI infection when used with clinical evaluation, lab findings, and epidemiological information.
